Reviews.Title: “Good experience. Overall decent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel B
Reviews.Content: After a nightmare at another hotel, I stayed here while in town to visit my grandmother who was ill in the hospital. Upon arrival the lobby was very clean and even smelled nice. The front desk clerk was extremely busy and since I also work for a Quality Inn and Suites, I know how crazy things can get so just because the guest service agent couldn't jump up for me I wouldn't find it to be a cause for complaint. The hotel is older though it seems some rennovations have been made or are currently in the works. My room was small but clean, no hairs in the bathroom which is a huge plus for most travelers. The beds were comfortable, wifi was fast, overall the room was well maintained. The General Manager pulled me into conversation and was very nice and professional. He seemed genuine when asking me about how my stay was and that was before he knew I worked for another Choice Hotel, so that is another plus. After hearing some not so nice things about this property from travelers, I can say honestly that my experience was good and I suggest that people find out for themselves as I did. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here multiple times in the past 3 years!”
Reviews.Author: Kellie J
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Seatac Quality Inn several times and appreciate the friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness of the rooms. They have an excellent breakfast and shuttle service. It's nice to see friendly faces when you go to the "city" from a small town. We will stay there many times in the future as needed, I'm sure. Thank you, Quality Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, decent service”
Reviews.Author: Sonics
Reviews.Content: This was my second in a few weeks using this hotel. I must say, the service is greatly improved. From the bellman "Tom" who took care of my needs, to Cecelia, who checked up on me, to the new manager( wow, he is a tall man) who dropped everything to take by bags to my room when I checked in. The manager was even pouring coffee, asking about our stay the next morning during breakfast. This hotel is going through a transition as the hotel is upgrading the hotel by installing a new elevator, as well I saw the new king beds that the hotel was installing at their hotel.I was on the 3rd floor. My room had a pillow-top mattress, and it was so comfortable - nice improvement! The manager mentioned me that the hotel is dedicated to " new level of service". I look forward to his new improvements. Thank you to Tom, Cecelia, and to the new manager, you made my stay pleasant. I will be back.Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned.”
Reviews.Author: Wally369
Reviews.Content: We missed a connecting flight in Seattle so the airline put us up in the Quality Inn. It was not a pleasant experience. It took 45 minutes for the van to come and pick us up. It drove right past us the first time...didn't even slow down to see if people were waiting. After several phone calls to the reception (who couldn't have cared less) the van finally stopped to pick us up. The rooms... horrible. Our rooms were so cold we ended up grabbing all of the bedding off of the 2nd bed to use on the one we were sleeping in. I turned on the heater and had to shut it off because the smell was so bad. My associate and I had adjoining rooms and both of us ended up doing the same thing and sleeping with our heads under the covers to try and stay warm. About 5am all you could hear were people walking around above you... and it was so loud. Really bad floor creaks and you could hear every foot step. I have travelled all over the world and stayed in some pretty nasty places, but I just could not believe an airline would put their passengers in this place. There are much better places to stay near the Seattle airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy for airport”
Reviews.Author: RonandJoan
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for an airport shuttle. We had a rental car form the airport to get around town, so we checked in, then took the car back and then called the shuttle to return us to the motel. The man was a little late since he had been delivering people to various restaurants in the area: what a service for all! It is rather an large property and they wer enot busy. We stayed, had a nice breakfast and then took the shuttle back to the airport for our flight. Yes, we would recommend this: it is an excellent Quality Inn stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: TheClarks2011
Reviews.Content: was only at this hotel for about 5 hrs, didn't eat breakfast, all the help was very nice, shuttle driver was nice, room was old and musty on the first floor, just an ok stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: travelfanforever
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times over the years. It looks like they recently remodeled. It must be a popular place because each time we have stayed here, they are full. They have a shuttle to the airport, a great breakfast and are pet friendly. This time we were on the 3rd floor which was nice, however, last time we stayed on the lowest level and that smelled musty.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Frank H
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at this motel as we had an early morning flight out of SeaTac. We discovered that this is an old run down motel with no elevators, decor from the 70's, the smell of stale tobacco everywhere and by far the loudest air conditioning unit I have ever come across. On check in and check out I was made to wait while the lone staff member tried to work out the person in front's problems. Pay the extra $15-$30 dollars and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Wacky68
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel (the last time was in 2009). Again for the money it was excellent. On this occasion I stayed for 3 nights. my only hiccup was the shuttle bus took 2 phonecalls and a 40 minute wait to pick me up when I arrived. However the recptionist apologised as soon as I arrived at the hotel. The buffet breakfast seems to have been expanded and included - pastries, cereal, yogurt, eggs and sausages. They still provide a picnic breakfast if you check out early. The airport shuttle bus is now made avaialble to guests to ferry you to the light rail link that connects the airport to the city. This is a great improvement on the hotel bus I used last time and makes travelling into the city very cheap. The train station is only a 15minute walk if you inclined to excercise. The room was clean and I found the hotel very quiet. That may be becuase I always travel with and use earplugs. This time I also used a couple of the local restuarants for evening meals and was very pleased with them. (One an American Diner and one a Thai). As a single female traveller I would definetly recommend this hotel and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “spend a little more and DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: christian_smedberg
Reviews.Content: While I was on business and trying to save the company some money I choose a pretty cheap room near SEA-TAC (I think it was 69 or 74 a night). The room was small and awful, everything was cramped and the table was wobbly which made for typing on my laptop a pain. the shuttle took 42 minutes to arrive to the airport to pick me up. Their computers were down when I checked in and then again while I checked out, so I couldn't get a receipt and when I asked if they could email it to me they said to call them the next day they would fax it to me. Spend the 10-15 dollars more and stay at the Hampton

Reviews.Title: “The website photos are misleading. This place is gross.”
Reviews.Author: AT429
Reviews.Content: Stay away. This place has a musty smell, the sheets were worn and stained, the bathroom was dirty and dingy and there was no remote for the tv. There's also no elevator which is problematic for this traveling with luggage. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money spent!”
Reviews.Author: dc_flyer
Reviews.Content: First off, it is not a 4 or 5 star hotel. So, people that stay here and feel disappointed should realize that it's a 3 star hotel. If you want perfection, stay at the Doubletree down the street and pay a lot more money!! I love the fact that it is so close to the airport and they have a excellent airport transportation that is free. My room was very clean with a nice bed, with four pillows. FREE wi-fi service and FREE breakfast. Clean bathroom with nice shower. And, in room coffee maker. Good cable TV too. It's nothing fancy, but a good value for the money. The front desk staff is very friendly and patient. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient to airport, few amenities”
Reviews.Author: Eileen3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the airport, and provides free shuttle service which is nice. No swimming pool or spa. Breakfast was so-so. Service OK, not outstanding. No elevator, which makes getting to the top floor inconvenient, and very difficult for anyone with a disability.

Reviews.Title: “1.5 stars is about right”
Reviews.Author: KenSPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: The free airport shuttle was convenient and the driver offered to take us to local restaurants. The outside of the hotel is acceptable. Our room had a strong cleaning chemical smell. The bed was hard. We booked this hotel based on an advertisement at Pacific Central Train station in Vancouver, BC. The advertisement was for $55/night. When we arrived at the hotel they said it was $65/night and could not change it. I called the Quality Inn Customer Relations number and they said they would have the local hotel manager call me but he never did. We left the hotel after one night because of no resolution to the false advertising. Of course the $65 rate was for a room in the basement (no elevator) with choice of a view of dirt or a high fence in front of a storage yard. On the plus side: the room had a refrigerator and microwave. Breakfast was fair with sausage and watery eggs, cereal, muffins, yogurt, fruit, and juices. They did have a waffle machine which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Location, But Old”
Reviews.Author: Comoxbox
Reviews.Content: We chose the Quality Inn for it's proximity to the airport and the Park and Fly package. We were not disappointed with either of those aspects. It is only 5-10 minutes from the airport - depending on traffic and the package was a decent price. The car was safe and parking is just on the south side of the lobby so is quite visible. The airport shuttle was free - but make sure you sign up when you check in, as they use a van and it does have limited space. Pick up from the airport was easy - they come when you call from the courtesy phone. We found the front desk staff very helpful and friendly - even at 4:00 am! The staff at the breakfast were also very friendly. The main drawback to this hotel is its age. It is clearly an older building and in some places it really shows. The hallway carpets were not pretty. The a/c - athough it worked, it was quite loud. There are NO elevators at all. So if you have trouble with stairs make sure you ask for a room in the 200s - that is actually their main floor. When we arrived for our first night, we were on the second floor and could really hear the people walking in the room above us. On our return, we were on the 3rd floor, so that was not a problem. The room was large, although very dated (read harvest gold decorations). It was clean and it was nice to have the fridge and micro. I also liked that the sink was outside of the bathroom. There were enough towels for all 4 of us - but the bath towels are quite small and thin. The shower was not good - even with it on, half of the water was still coming out of the faucet so the stream was not strong. Toiletries were provided. The breakfast was good. Lots of variety and lots of seating. We would at least consider staying here again, but it would not be a sure thing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Customer Service - Rude and Discourteous”
Reviews.Author: Travel_1198
Reviews.Content: Very rude, unfriendly staff and manager. Called multiple times to talk to the manager regarding my reservation. Staff would not connect me to the manager despite me leaving my contact info. Worst of all was the last call when the lady said showed attitude and said that it is my choice to stay or not.

Reviews.Title: “Yucky”
Reviews.Author: HOPE_
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night using my free points before heading to Whidbey Island. I wondered why I was asked if I would take a first floor room, later to find out that really it's in the basement with windows up high looking out at car guts. The room was minimal and breakfast was so scarce and crowded that some people had to stand in the hall and some outside to eat. It's like an airport factory with everyone waiting for take-off. Pass it by if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it..”
Reviews.Author: michellenas
Reviews.Content: I tried to save money on this trip and thought by cutting hotel costs it would be the best way. Unfortunately I made this decision and my family and I suffered. The rooms are all non smoking, or so say the signs on every door. The first room we had was Ok until we turned on the A.C. The air coming out of the A.C. smelt of cigarette SMOKE. We waited a few minutes to see if it would maybe go away, it didn't. The second room they gave us smelt of MOLD and very musty. The third room they gave us smelt of a book store. Because we already prepaid the room , we could not just cancel our reservation. We stayed in the third room and ended up spraying it with a room spray that was unexpectedly packed into my bag. The hallways also always smelt of cigarettes. Next time I am paying the extra $$$ to get a better room and no worries. Also parking seemed to fit exactly one car per room and had very tight spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: rjnjjwa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this property a number of times over the past four years. I can understand some of the reviews that complain about not having an elevator - it doesn't. Based on our stays, it seems that the higher the floor, the better the quality of rooms. On our recent stay, we stayed on the third floor. The room was spotlessly clean, had no odor, the matress very comfortable, the bedsheets and pillows clean as a pin, and the room was outstanding overall. The hotel has been renovated and modernized in the last two years, and I would rate this Quality Inn in the top 10% of Quality Inns in which I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!”
Reviews.Author: LEGrayNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there 3 nights while visiting Seattle. I am a Choice Privileges Member and 2 of my nights I used my points and they were free. Awful smell, no elevator--my husband is a disabled vet. The girl at the front desk was nice enough but a little scatter-brained. She did give us a brochure about a tour. I called her from my room to ask her to book it. 20 minutes later my husband called to check (she said she would call us w/details). She had forgotten. Also, one morning we used the laundry services. We stepped across the hall to look at the fitness room. When we turned on the lights one of the male employees was sitting there watching TV in the dark. So, needless to say, I didn't go there the next morning to exercise. Best thing was that the bed was comfortable. The fat-free milk tasted almost spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay visiting Seattle”
Reviews.Author: TimOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I was concerned when I read some of the other recent reviews found at this hotel but I have stayed here a few times in the past and was trusting my past experience. I'm glad I did. I did not find or experience the complaints expressed by others. I fly alot for business and have stayed in many hotels where the rooms are much smaller for twice the price, especially east coast or in the larger cities. The furniture in the room was fairly new as I saw the manufaturing date in the drawer of the nightstand and it matched the other pieces in the room. The carpet in the room looked and felt new and was deep green. Not the gold carpet shown in the hotels pictures. The queen size bed was clean, comfortable and did not feel dated. The exercise room did have a mix of older and new equipment and it did all work. The hallway carpet was being replaced durning my stay so it did make it difficult getting to my room but they helped with my luggage. The hotel is 20 or so years old as are most of the hotels in the area, but I have seen improvements at this hotel over my previous visits. It was fairly quiet as I did not hear the cars or airplane traffic in my room. The biggest thing this hotel has going for it is the staff. Being the housekeepers, shuttle driver or front desk they are alway very friendly, helpfull and responsive. They really make me feel welcome. Not home but close. I have stayed in other chain hotels in the area that have a little nicer lobby and common areas but not worth the higher price of the room. for my money these guys are still my best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful service and great breakfast in morning...”
Reviews.Author: SmilezL
Reviews.Content: Had a comfortable room , friendly front desk .. Breakfast was great.. Shuttle service was on time.. My overall stay was good , will go back and stay again.. Recommond to stay here inexpensive and good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “ROOM SMELLED LIKE CAT URINE OR BLACK MOLD !!”
Reviews.Author: ohmywow
Reviews.Content: Alaska Airlines put us up in this hotel for one night because they were running behind and we missed our connecting flight ..We were given a basement room .. No elevator.. Had to carry 50 pound bag down and up stairs ...Had to keep outside vent open just to breath .. Made room very cold .. If they put you up even for one night it is too long UP EVEN FOR .. RUN..

Reviews.Title: “Old, dumpy motel with free breakfast & airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night'. Wasn't expecting much, since it was so cheap. My surprise is that Quality Inn would allow their name to be associated with this place. Here's the good - free breakfast incl hot food - free parking and airport shuttle; it's an 8 min drive to the SEA airport - two computers in the lobby, no charge - coin washer and dryer - room included safe, fridge, coffeemaker, writing desk and separate 2 chair round table - heater in window, although no thermostat, did the job - TV worked well. Good size, although not flat panel - local and 1-800 calls are free - carpet in my Queen bed room was old but clean, furniture is old but okay The bad - parking lot doesn't feel safe at night - bathroom could really use a makeover - old small bed pillows - ugly open closet - floors in my room did not seem even - hallways are unappealing - you can hear your neighbours and planes The ugly - fitness room is gross. Has 3 pieces, all old: a Bowflex, a treadmill, and bike. There's a good size sauna, but from it's appearance, not clear it worked There are many chain hotels in this area. I would not return to this 'Quality Inn'.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Inn gets the most bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: jbriques
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to the budget-conscious traveler. It's a comfortable and clean hotel with really helpful and friendly staff, free shuttle to the airport and lightrail station, free breakfast, and walking distance to a few food options. The reason we chose to stay at Quality Inn was because of the price. Being the stereotypical poor college kids, we were on a tight budget for the small vacation we planned. I must say, you definitely get the most bang for your buck at this hotel. The rooms were tastefully decorated and large. They were probably the largest out of the three we stayed in during our trip. We had no problem with storing our luggage and had plenty of walking space. They also offered a GREAT free breakfast: pancakes, eggs, sausages, muffins, cereals, toast, donuts and turnovers, juice, coffee and milk. That being said, this wasn't a fancy hotel with gold leafing and marble floors, walls, etc. It was comfortable and clean. The location wasn't bad, either. It was within walking distance of several restaurants and convenience stores, rental car offices, and if you don't mind the hike it's within walking distance to the airport and lightrail train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but wouldnt use shuttle service to pier”
Reviews.Author: saladshooter_2002
Reviews.Content: We paid $12 per person to have the shuttle take us to and pick us up at the pier from our cruise. We even scheduled a pick up time and everything, we called when the ship arrived, they didnt pick us up until 1 1/2 hours later!!!! I would just pay for a taxi. It seems like the manager is more interested in saving money instead of catering to his customers that paid for a service. We found out he waited till he had passengers to take to the pier till he would come and get us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but very run down”
Reviews.Author: newarkdelawaregin
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a reasonable price, very helpful staff, a convenient location, and good shuttle service to the airport. The bath room area was very clean. However, the hallways and room furnishings were old and dingy looking, and the mattress was exceptionally old and lumpy. Our room had the carpet baseboard strips falling off the wall and was very musty.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel value for Seattle traveller”
Reviews.Author: seniortraveler12
Reviews.Content: There are umpteen motels near the Seattle airport, but I chose this one because I am a member of Choice Hotel's points program and could get two of my five vacation nights free. Even if I had paid for all five nights, I would have been pleased with my stay. Visiting Seattle, one might not think of staying near the airport, but a helpful staff person at Seattle Southside Visitor Center, which I phoned while planning my trip, offered the tip that the motels and hotels south of the city are a lot less expensive than downtown, and most offer free shuttle to the airport where you can take the light rail (30 minutes) downtown. I didn't need to rent a car and saved a bundle. Public transportation in Seattle is cheap, safe, convenient and pleasant--there are FREE buses downtown, where I spent much of my time. I was also able to take an express bus to Tacoma for a day trip, by walking four blocks from the motel to the bus stop. I got a free ride to the light rail station whenever I wanted it, and even walked (less than a mile) to the station one sunny day when I wanted some exercise. My room was clean and very quiet--when booking, I asked for a quiet room on the top floor. The neighborhood is perfectly safe, and as a woman who travels alone often, that is a priority for me. The only airport noise I noticed was around the time I normally wake up; otherwise the planes don't seem to go over this location much. Comfortable bed and everything clean. Microwave and refrig in room came in handy. The staff is very helpful (Janelle especially), kept my luggage in storage after I checked out because I was going on a full day tour of Mt. Rainier on my last day. I have rarely encountered a staff that is as friendly and helpful. There is a hot breakfast buffet, free Sunday newspaper, internet computers in the lobby, coffee available all day. Overall, this was one of my most pleasant motel stays. If there is a criticism to be made, it is that the old carpet in the hallways detracts from the otherwise pleasant atmosphere, and needs replacement. For people less physically fit, be aware that there are no elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Average, no frills, more like a motel”
Reviews.Author: Hilobb
Reviews.Content: We stayed over one night before a flight out of SeaTac. We arrived late, but front desk was friendly and we were checked in efficiently. However, there were no more parking spaces. The clerk came out to tell us which cars we could park behind; I guess there were some cars parked there for an extended period. The room itself is motel like, very no frills and utilitarian. The decor seemed a little tired and worn out, but for the most part clean. Breakfast was not bad, with scrambled eggs and sausages in addition to the usual waffles and pastries other hotels offer. The line up to use the waffle maker was too long for us to wait though since we had to catch a flight. Overall an ok place to stay for one night, especially if you need to catch a flight, but I wouldn't want to stay longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: paradisefound619
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Inn Sea-Tac for one night before our Alaskan cruise. A friend picked us up at the airport and took us sight seeing but the free shuttle would have been nice had we needed it. I wish I would have really known how far the hotel was from downtown Seattle because after our sight seeing it was quite the drive (especially since we were on the far side of Seattle in Kirkland). Once we arrived at the hotel the staff was helpful and nice. They told us about the options for getting to Pier 91 for our cruise the following morning and that there would be breakfast. I was under the impression that the hotel had 3 floor starting at ground level but it really had 1 floor that was below ground level, unless you walked outside down a hill to the back door. So, we had rooms on the 1st floor but had to go down a flight of stairs. This was hard to do especially with our heavy luggage. Mainly I felt bad for my mom. After a long day of walking around in Seattle this was the last thing she needed. We helped her out though and all was well....until we went to get into our rooms. My husband and I entered ours fine but my mom couldn't get her key to work. We tried it about 10 times and then went to the front desk. The front desk worker came down to help and she couldn't get the key to work either. She even tried her master room key and it was no opening. So, my mom was giving another room...just one room down but she was tired and crabby with this incident. After we got settled in, we grabbed some pop from the vending machines and watched a movie. Then it was time for bed. The beds were fine, smaller queens but okay. We all slept pretty well since we were tired from traveling. The shower was great in the morning. The halls were noisy with others leaving and the cleaning staff was talking loudly to each other about some issues. The breakfast was packed and only okay. There were two computers in the lobby which were nice to access before our 7 day cruise. I was please with the available and speed of the internet! We chose to take a taxi to Pier 91 because the shuttle was booked except for a 10 leave time which I thought was too early to get to the pier but it probably would have been okay. The taxi was only about $8 so not a huge deal to us. Probably wouldn't stay here again but it served it's purpose for our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent travelers hotel near airport with all of the basics.”
Reviews.Author: NYGent
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were in Seattle for a wedding and we did not want to spend too much on the hotel. We paid aproximatly $55 a night pre-paid, which was about $100 less then downtown. We had a rental car and we were only about 30 minutes away from downtown. The hotel is basic but it had everything we needed including a microwave, a refrigrator, free wi-fi internet and a free breakfast that included eveything that you would expect from a continential breakfast plus eggs and a machine to make homemade waffels. The staff was always freindly and accomidating and the average customer seemed to be travelers like ourselves. If I were in Seattle again I would definatly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay near airport.. with free shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: patrickmeyer
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect except for one thing: the room smelled a bit strange. It wasn't smoky or musty, but a strange unidentifiable odor. But we quickly adapted and shortly couldn't tell. Other than that, this hotel was exactly what we needed. We used the free shuttle to the airport twice and it was perfect both times. At our request, he dropped us at the light rail station the second time. The beds were comfortable, the shower clean and hot, and the amenities quite excellent for the price. The room included a microwave and a safe for your valuables. The staff was helpful and polite. The included continental breakfast was above average with waffle maker machine, fresh coffee, some fruit, juice, and pastries. I highly recommend this hotel if you're on a budget and all you need is a place to sleep with shuttle and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Janelle at the front desk makes this place a gem!”
Reviews.Author: VADON
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place 2 nights before our AK cruise and one night after our cruise. Janelle at the front desk was a wonderfu help with tour information, shuttle service to the docks, and overall friendliness toward the out of town guests. Her spirit and attitude just brightens the lobby. In addition to Janelle, the morning breakfast was outstanding with eggs, bacon/sausage, selection of pastries-bagels and cereals, and a waffle iron to cook your own. Apple/Orange Juice, coffee, and milk rounded out a breakfast good enough for a resturant unto itself and all included in the price of the room. The rooms themselves were a bit older, but very comfortable with a small refrigerator/ microwave/ ironing board-iron, and hair dryer available in the room. My only complaint was that the pillows on the bed were only about the size of your head and not large enough to keep your head from rolling off for those who are "active" sleepers (try using 2 pillows and your head ended up stuck between the 2). Overall great bargin for the cost-conscious.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect (hopefully not much)”
Reviews.Author: soah_kim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was less expensive that some of the other Sea-Tac options. Our room was clean except for a slight old-hotel smell. The tub and shower curtain were relatively new, but I caught a couple whiffs of mildew in the bathroom. This is an old and outdated hotel, and it shows, but we wanted to save 20 bucks, and I think it was worth it. Parking was free, which was a nice bonus. I would stay here again if I was just passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Great cruise package”
Reviews.Author: girlygirlinid
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and nice sized. We were able to easily fit a roll away in with two queen beds. Decent breakfast. Great cruise packages.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good breakfast, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: housetenders
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel - Great service and they offer a prompt shuttle service to the airport which is right around the corner. well kept rooms. and good price. If you stay walk around the corner to Dave's DIner- super food

Reviews.Title: “great value would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Nancyrc
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk were top notch. Everthing was nice and clean. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom in the non smoking room did smell of smoke. We turned on the fan and kept the door closed. There was a refrigerator and microwave. We caught the free shuttle at 5 am and it was too early for breakfast, so they gave us a lunch to go with a yorgurt and danish. There was fresh coffee in the lobby and a free USA Today. It took 7 minutes to get to our gate at the airport. There is a casino and 2 restaurants across the street. This was a great value and I will stay here anytime I have an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “don't choose this one”
Reviews.Author: JBMASON
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this one. Booked it through hotels-rates.com was not a clean place. I found it not to be what it looked like on the web site. Changed rooms and still didn't like it. The rooms were smoking rooms, even though I was told they were non-smoking as per smell, light bulds were burned out. I chose another hotel and called for a shuttle to pick me up. Turned my key inat the desk and when asked for a refund I was told I didn't check out properly. Have contacted Choice Hotels to no avail yet and contacted Hotels-rates.com also to no avail. Beware--- if it is cheap $ wise it will not be a place you want to stay

Reviews.Title: “Good value motel; very close to airport”
Reviews.Author: maestrolms
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, and found it comfortable and reasonably-priced A full buffet breakfast was included, with waffles. The room was quite pleasant, even during a spell of very cold temperatures. It was less than a five-minute drive to the car rental location at the airport, and is in easy reach of I-5 and an alternative route to downtown Seattle and Tacoma. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Dated property, close to airport - inexpensive, no frills & no elevator.”
Reviews.Author: AvisArt
Reviews.Content: This is an old three-floor, Quality Inn, basement level, ground level and upstairs level. We stayed here two nights on our way to Vancouver for an Alaskan cruisetour. Pluses include good location-very close to Airport, adequate breakfast, inexpensive price, OK rooms with nice front desk staff. However, they do not have an elevator and it was a pain dragging our luggage up & down the stairs. Rooms are basic, staff are nice - it's an old facility, which is fine if you only need a place to sleep with basic amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Evicted under threat of arrest by management”
Reviews.Author: travelermanUsa
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed about the Quality Inn at Seatac Airport was that the door from the outside of the building to the first floor hallway was wide open, allowing anyone from the street and MANY mosquitoes to enter at will. When I tried to shower in the morning, I had no hot water. When I went to turn off the air conditioning unit, I found a half-smoked marijuana joint sticking out of the vents. I called the front desk to inform them about the lack of hot water and to ask that someone come down and remove their previos guest's drugs from my air conditioner. When I got back to the room that night, I had been locked out and was met at the door by the desk clerk and a note from the hotel manager. Apparently because I had the nerve to complain about no hot water and DRUGS left in my room, I had to leave the hotel immediately or the police would be called and I would be charged with trespassing. Enjoy your stay, just make sure you like mosquitoes and don't DARE complain unless you want to face possible arrest.

Reviews.Title: “Plain Jane but okay for Sea-Tac access”
Reviews.Author: Triptippers
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for one night before flying out of Sea-Tac the next morning, and didn't want to pay for ammenities we wouldn't need. Its sits just off the main drag (perpendicular to highway 99). Isn't really attractive (think cinderbrick and 1985 carpet) but it felt safe and that's something given the competitors' reviews. Friendly front desk and breakfast room staff. Very average rooms (low quality mattresses, small bathroom, but furniture in good condition). This place was okay, though not inexpensive, for our purposes. If you're looking for a base from which to visit the greater Seattle area, there must be better choices, as comingi back to this place at the end of each day woud seem a bit of a downer. Warning: unless you are hearing impaired, do not get a room anywhere near the ice machines which are in the stairwell in the center of the building, as they are the loudest we have ever heard (are the motors going out?? honestly!).

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly Average. A long way from Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Misty2k
Reviews.Content: This common or garden motel is average at best. The room quality was acceptable but I did wonder if the whiff of cleaning fluid was masking something. The big down side, which applies to all the SeaTac hotels) is the location. It is probably great if you are coming into or out of SeaTac airport (They have their own shuttle bus), but if you are looking for a cheap alternative to a downtown motel bear in mind that you are a long way from the tourist sights in Seattle. Once the Light Rail is extended to the airport (due December 2009) then this might be a viable option, but until then I'd suggest somewhere away from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Room was fine, hotel a little out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: MarlinPrice
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were excellent for a Quality Inn although the location and view was lacking. The Hotel was clean, and very well maintained. The internet worked fine in the room, beds comfortable. Our room was very clean and the bathroom spotless. We stayed only one night on a trip to Canada. The desk clerk was extremenly helpful in telling us the sights to see in Seattle and providing directions. The hotel is just south of Sea=Tac airport althought there was no plane noise in the rooms at all. They have a park and fly service as well as airport shuttle. Good value for the money here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Wagi
Reviews.Content: Above all the staff were exceptional. The rooms perhaps were dated, but they were clean and well appointed, parking was good, the free breakfast was excellent (if a bit crowded at times), and the price could not be beat. We stayed there two different nights and will certainly stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Park & Fly”
Reviews.Author: Brats
Reviews.Content: 1st let me say having checked around this was by far the best value for a 7 day Park & Fly $119...Having said that this hotel; is helpful,convenient,, free internett great breakfast till 9.20am everything was great. I must comment that compared with the other Quality Inn Hotels this one is dated, definitely needs a face lift . But that being said great value for money a 1/2 night stay is fine

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: weinerjw
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the most accomodating places I have ever stayed. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. It has everything from refridgerators, microwaves, safes and ironing boards in the rooms. Breakfast was great and so much more than your basic cereal etc.. like make your own waffles! The 1:00 extended checkout was great, too. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Typical airport motel surrounded by a string of such motels”
Reviews.Author: RabePaul
Reviews.Content: The area surrounding most USA airports is dominated by chain motels, parking facilities, rental car lots, and chain restaurants. Hiway 99 as it goes by Sea-Tac Airport is no exception. Lots of free enterprise to ensure good value; but not much uniqueness, charm, culture, or nightlife. If staying in this area, your best bet is to choose a place with the amenities you require that has the best price. Our price was $70 per night grand total. The staff was polite and professional. The room was quiet, clean, and fully stocked. It featured full bath, air-conditioning, clock radio, phone, TV (65 channels), coffee maker, mini-fridge, microwave, hair dryer, and in-room clothes iron. Free amenities included parking, airport shuttle, hot breakfast, local phone calls, and wireless internet access. On-site was a laundry room. Nearby were fast food places and convenience stores. One problem with a hiway filled with nothing but chain motels is that it is difficult to notice a place that is not right on the hiway. This motel is only a block from Hiway 99, but we missed it the first time we drove by. Don't repeat our mistake and not have the exact address of the place, as you might miss it in the boring sameness of the chains. Nothing magical about the place, but also nothing bad. If this place has the best price for your stay of a couple nights, you may as well choose it.

Reviews.Title: “Older but nice”
Reviews.Author: Janhome7
Reviews.Content: It is an older hotel, but it was well kept. The desk people were very helpful. They arranged transportation from the train station to the hotel. The rooms are a little crowded, but clean. The breakfast was way more than expected. Eggs, sausage, waffles, pasteries, cereal, fruit, and I'm probably leaving out something.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: Wacky68
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews I was dubious about booking this hotel. However, I was very pleasantly surprised. For the money it was excellent. I stayed here on 2 seperate nights (1 in June and 1 in July) before and after a trip to Alaska. On both occasions I arrived late and the staff were excellent checking me in. They were freindly and efficient. I had a lot of heavy kit with me and they assisted with my bags. As I left before breakfast on the first occasion they offered me a picnic which was ready as promised. On the second occasion the breakfast was adequate to set me up for a day's sightseeing in Seattle. There is a reasonably priced hotel bus which will pick up and take you into the city dropping near the Pike Place Market. (I paid just $14 for a return trip). The room was clean and I found the hotel very quiet. That may be becuase I always travel with and use earplugs. As a single female traveller I would definetly recommend this hotel and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: happymcmartin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as it states. Quality. Not fancy just average. No pool at this location. Breakfast is good. Shuttle service is nice. Rooms are smaller but they are ok for a nights stay. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B707
Reviews.Content: its a loud hotel you will hear everythink from your neiberhood and from above breakfast was standart nothink special the room was worn out but ahhh ok nearly clean BUT the stuff there is friendly and helpfull and you have free parking but thats all

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Airport Stay”
Reviews.Author: RogueMonk
Reviews.Content: We had no problems with out stay. The room was clean, and in good working order. It wasn't anything fancy, but fine for an airport stay. The free breakfast was OK--there was cereal, pastries, fruit, hard-boiled egss, and a few other things. The shuttle to the airport was great. It was on-time and the driver was friendly. The staff were all polite. There was really nothing wrong with this place. If I had to come up with a complaint, it would be the hollow walls.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rakotomaraina
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was great. We had absolutely no problems. I don't know what these negative reviews are talking about. We stayed there and commuted downtown to see Seattle. The hotel was located fairly close and everything worked out great. I recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: tferbrache
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel! The bed sagged, the room was small and the hotel was noisy, run-down and unclean! We were booked for 2 nights - we asked for a refund for the second night and went to a better hotel! The clerk was more concerned that she not refund the night we stayed (which I didn't ask for) than finding out why we were leaving early. Go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “I'd definately come back”
Reviews.Author: realtygirlPnw
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much with the price being so reasonable. But this is what I got. QUALITY service, quality friendly people, clean room, close to the airport BUT quiet. Great breakfast. Would I recommend this to my best friend? YES in fact she was with me and would come as well, I would recommend this to my child as well. Good job. I must remember this. Wi-fi, cleanness, reasonable, great breakfast, service. Nice work.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: dangrad
Reviews.Content: Spent just one night here but will go back for a longer stay next time. Conveniently located near Sea-Tac. Rooms were clean and well-decorated. Ours had a microwave and fridge in addition to coffeemaker and hairdryer. Hotel offers expanded continental breakfast including waffles, hard-boiled eggs, and yogurt. No problems with aircraft noise, comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: worthia1
Reviews.Content: We missed a connecting flight and Air Canada put us up in the hotel for a night. What a terrible hotel. NOTHING Quality about it! The hotel was dark, dirty and smelly. The lady at the front desk was nice but that's about as good as it got. We were almost afraid to sleep between the sheets. The bed was terrible and the bathroom was old and dirty. We could not wait to get out of there. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “not great, but ok in situation”
Reviews.Author: jujupearson
Reviews.Content: We were shuffled to this hotel during the windstorm because the place we had was out of power. The hallways were dirty, needed vacuumed. They jacked up the price by at least $25 cause they knew they had us, so to speak. The room was clean, very basic. They had a great shuttle driver, Jimmy!! they were very accomodating in getting us around in the van. let us stay in our room past the check out time because our flight was delayed. Overall, ok in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend this property”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiBlondie
Reviews.Content: I can not recommend this property. The halls are very dingy, the carpets need to be replaced. The room just ok, no elevators, have to lug suitcase up a dirty stairway. We traveled 15 hrs., and were exhausted. Got to the hotel at midnight. We were awoken by the night desk clerk at 3:00 a.m., asking if the people who stayed in our room the night before, could come up and get some things they left in a dresser drawer. No, was the answer, but will put the drawer outside the room. At 3:15 a.m. phone rang again. Desk clerk said the people wanted to come up and search the room because some items were missing. Absolutely not, come back in the a.m. It was a poor decision of the night desk to wake us up and ask such a question. Also, housekeeping should have been more thorough in cleaning the room from the night before. We should not have paid for the room. Contacted the hotel mgm. after we got home, and after 6 wks, no response. Contacted Corporate and they sent us a gift certificate for a stay in another property. Would not stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Odor and Appearance”
Reviews.Author: Fell0w_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Our initial impression of this Quality Inn is that the facility has been heavily used for several years with no investment in upkeep. There were stains on all the carpets, no elevator to get luggage to the basement level, bedding that was worn out, and the odor of cigarettes permeated everything, even though our room was "non-smoking." There are other hotels in the same vicinity that looked like far better choices. Even though the staff was cordial, I would not stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Quality Inn I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Spokane203
Reviews.Content: I booked for 3 nights over the internet, having been very satisfied with Quality Inns other places. This one did not live up to those standards. The room was clean, the lobby attractive, the staff friendly, but the physical condition of much of the building leaves a lot to be desired. The hallways stink and the carpet is filthy! It was so bad that the smell carried into the room; I walked down to 7-11 to get some room deodorizer to cut through it. With a generous amount of that, then leaving the window open, it finally got better by the next morning. No elevators. Lots of physical upgrades needed. The front desk person told me that since they were an airport hotel the standards are lower for Quality Inn there. Ouch!! I've always known what to expect at Quality Inn, but this one has me doubting I'll ever take a chance again!

Reviews.Title: “A simple establishment”
Reviews.Author: mrdealfinder
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality Inn for 1 night (June 9). We arrived late Friday and had no problem finding parking or checking in. The staff were friendly and easy going. The lobby is small and had a few guests watching the TV and using the one computer with Internet access. Our room was one floor up (no elevators) and was clean. The carpet is old but one of the staff commented that management was going to redo all the carpeting. You could tell there was gum and other gunk in places on the carpet but it was more old than dirty. The main floor hallway had a strong smell of smoke but our 2nd floor hallway was OK. Bathroom was simple. The sink and mirror are part of the room. Our room had a microwave and a fridge. Local calls were free. We couldn't hear our neighbors even though it was apparently 100% full that night. That said the building is old and wood-frame so I wouldn't be surprised with some of the other reviews. One of our friends couldn't sleep because of the occasional airplane flying overhead. Breakfast was very simple, with cereal, the standard waffle-iron waffles, coffee and juice. I'd stay again but then I again there are many other hotels in the area so I might try a neighboring one. Overall, no real complaints. It's no Holiday Inn but then it doesn't pretend to be. Clean room, nice staff, cheap rates.

Reviews.Title: “Thankful”
Reviews.Author: Filternet
Reviews.Content: We could stay at the hotel after an emergency at the airport and treatment at the hospital. The room was clean and had everything we needed, great shower and nice smelling bathsoaps. Breakfast was good. Most of all, the people working at the hotel were very friendly. We had stayed at the Holiday Inn in Renton one night before, which was 150% more expensive and only half as nice. So thank you, quality inn, for living up to your name!

Reviews.Title: “Yucky”
Reviews.Author: ariesgal
Reviews.Content: We walked in and stayed at this Quality Inn for Sat. May 26, 07. Paid $69 + tax for the room, room 116 it was. Dim hallways, no elevators, smell smoke everywhere. Everything is true in the review dated Jan 7, 2007. Blankket and all sheets, pillow and mattress were very flimsy. But can't turn the strong AC off since it's very stuffy so we were to wear more clothes to bed, esp. when there's not enough blankets for warmth. It was clean (enough). Lighting is dim throughout the hotel. Fridge and microwave in the room. We actually saw many plane crew members stay here too - to my surprise. Good location for the airport, great value esp. with breakfast, but we wouldn't wanna stay there ever again. P.S. there's a small casino right across the street for those who are interested.

Reviews.Title: “Not likely to return”
Reviews.Author: EmilyCanada
Reviews.Content: We were flying out early in the morning, so decided to drive down and stay at an airport hotel and park our car for 8 days. Quality Inn had the best deal price-wise. The good: The price. The staff were helpful, friendly, efficient and knowledgable. The driver to the airport was on-time and friendly (shuttle runs every half hour). A free breakfast is available from 4:30am on, and is not bad...coffee, orange juice, muffins, danish, and a waffle maker. Showers had good pressure and hot water. There was a fridge and safe in the room. Location is right by the airport. The bad: the hotel hallways are really dirty and run down. New carpeting and a serious cleaning job needed. Room was ok..bed was a bit soft, and the sheet were quite thin. There is no elevator. For one night it is livable, but I wouldn't go back if I had a choice. It served the purpose we needed, and our car was fine when we returned (in a lit parking area in front of the hotel. Good size stalls). Safe travels, E

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, not again”
Reviews.Author: ganon
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, when Quailty Inn took over this previous Travel Lodge they may not have been aware of the poor building quality. This hotel is listed as 3 stars on many sites. The staff is friendly and if the star rating was based strictly on amenities found within the room (mini fridge, microwave, hair dryer, iron and board etc) I too would give it 3 stars. But the hotel itself is a older building with paper thin walls and the floors constantly squeak as guests walk up and down the halls and back and forth in the very very small rooms. If you arrive late parking will also be a challenge due to the limited number of spaces with in the fenced property. There are many other newer 1 and 2 star hotels in the area that would give you a better nights sleep. I would avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic & Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were doing a reverse park and fly, shuttle was excellent! Car safety we felt was good as well. Room basic, clean but nothing great. Just a place to shower and rest your head. Staff was very helpful. We noticed a couple of gentlemen airline staff also using the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn Sea-Tac Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 2900 S 192nd St., Seattle, WA 98188 (Formerly Travelodge)
